headline: BREAKING: Judge deals huge blow to Biden effort to limit ICE enforcement
author: DML News App
sentences:
Here, the answer is no.”
Promoted Content
In November 2020, Arizona Attorney General Mark Brnovich, Montana Attorney General Austin Knudsen, and Ohio Attorney General Dave Yost filed a lawsuit against the Biden administration in over the policy revision, which they said “dramatically ties the hands of immigration officers, halting nearly all deportations.”
Brnovich celebrated the ruling, writing on Twitter, “VICTORY: A federal judge just blocked the lawless Biden Administration policy that halted nearly all deportations after our office challenged this guidance.

“DHS contends that seemingly mandatory statutes must be read flexibly to permit efficient law enforcement.”
Judge Newman, a Trump appointee who took office in November 2020, wrote, “At bottom, that is what this dispute is about: can the Executive displace clear congressional command in the name of resource allocation and enforcement goals?

Promoted Content
District Judge Michael Newman of the Southern District of Ohio ruled Tuesday in favor of the Republican attorneys general of Arizona, Montana, and Ohio, issuing a preliminary injunction prohibiting President Joe Biden from imposing new guidelines for laws regarding consequences for illegal immigration.

As the most reliable and balanced news aggregation service on the internet, DML News App offers the following information published by WashingtonExaminer:
A federal judge has blocked the Biden administration from imposing limitations on Immigration and Customs Enforcement arrests, detentions, and removals.

The article goes on to state the following:
“The States sue because they believe DHS skirted Congress’s immigration enforcement mandates when it issued a policy that prioritizes certain high-risk noncitizens for apprehension and removal,” Newman wrote in his ruling.
